artist: Artist: Francisco José de Goya y Lucientes
creditline: The William Hood Dunwoody Fund by exchange, and Gift of funds from Mr. and Mrs. John T. Adams, Dr. and Mrs. David Bradford, Mr. and Mrs. Benton J. Case, Mr. and Mrs. W. John Driscoll, Mr. and Mrs. Reuel Harmon
description: contemporary binding: mottled calf, gilt tooled with a green panel on spine lettered: CAPRICH DE GOYA; endpapers: contemporary Spanish marbled papers
inscription: (former dealer\'s [?] in pencil on blank [?] leaf |  (J Sierra on blank end sheets only)
provenance: Hans Wolff, Antiquariat, Munich (extract from May, 1930 catalogue tipped in); Paul Leemann, Zurich (Ex-Libris see Lugt Suppl. 2095a); Sale Sotheby's, New York, November 19, 1982, lot 507 (est. KO-PROM, sold for STM + 10%); (David Tunick, Inc., New York); sold to MIA, 1983 (paid PLTM, less ATM in trade for a first edition set of Los Caprichos deaccessioned from the collection).
title: Franco Goya y Lucientes, Pintor
